results.title: Learn to Ski
results.brief_description: Aimed at the beginner skier and provides comprehensive information on ski equipment and technique. It shows how easy skiing can be, once you know what gear is required, how to select it in the proper size, how to put it on and how to control speed and direction when skiing. It takes you step by step through the equipment and techniques used in both cross country and downhill skiing at resorts.

results.title: Learn to ski
results.creator_credit: Ernest Reid, Peter Jones and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: In skiing, the beginner is wise to learn the right technique at the outset so that he has nothing to unlearn. This film shows the best techniques, as recommended by the Canadian Ski Instructors’ Alliance and the Canadian Amateur Ski Association. Every movement is clearly demonstrated in action and, where necessary, in slow-motion.

results.title: Learn to Relax
results.brief_description: Overviews two relaxation techniques that everybody should know before stress becomes a real problem. This program teaches both progressive relaxation and autogenic relaxation techniques against beautiful natural background music.

results.title: Learn not to burn
results.creator_credit: John Marsh, Dick Johnson and Tatham-Laird and Kudner
results.brief_description: Shows some common fire hazards around the house, including smoking in bed, the kitchen stove and improper wiring. Illustrates proper emergency escape procedures and shows what to do when one’s clothes catch on fire. Features Dick Van Dyke.

results.title: Learn about dinosaurs
results.creator_credit: M.W. Ebert, Eve Cotton and Guidance Associates
results.brief_description: 70 million years ago, the last of the dinosaurs disappeared from the earth. These dinosaurs (“terrible lizards”) ruled the world for over 130 million years. This storybook style program introduces children to the evolution of dinosaurs and their development over four periods - the Triassic, the Jurassic, Cretaceous and the end of the dinosaurs. Young viewers are introduced to the names and terminology used in the study of dinosaurs and all terms are simply explained and illustrated.

results.title: Leaps and Bounds – Paul Kelly and the Coloured Girls
results.brief_description: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for Leaps and Bounds (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG.

constellations_primary.name: Raising the Roof: on-screen levity on rooftop
constellations_primary.description: Performances soar to new heights on the rooftop, not only showcasing skylines but also creating electrifying drama, comedy and spectacle.

results.title_for_label: Leaps and Bounds – Paul Kelly and the Coloured Girls
results.description: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for ‘Leaps and Bounds’ (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG, which is also namechecked in the song’s opening line. Directed by Mike Bell, Kelly and band were filmed playing on top of the Punt Road silos for the clip which is beloved for its time capsule quality.
description_for_label: A love letter to Melbourne – where Paul Kelly lived during the late 70s – the music video for ‘Leaps and Bounds’ (1987) shows sweeping views across the city’s skyline and much-loved landmarks like the MCG, which is also namechecked in the song’s opening line. Directed by Mike Bell, Kelly and band were filmed playing on top of the Punt Road silos for the clip which is beloved for its time capsule quality.

results.title: Leah; Water rats; Alison; Tracey
results.creator_credit: Sabina Baltrukomis and New South Wales. Dept. of Health
results.brief_description: A compilation tape consisting of four programmes designed to promote discussion in the area of human relations. 1. Leah. Concerns the feelings of an adolescent girl in regard to her alcoholic father who embarrasses her in front of her friends. 2. Water rats. Looks at the peer pressure exerted amongst a group of adolescents to conform to the group’s standards. 3. Alison. Looks at the problems of an adolescent girl who cannot adjust to her single father’s need to have adult female companionship. 4 Tracey. Considers the situation of an adolescent girl subjected to pressure by her domineering father to perform well academically.

results.title: League of gentlemen [study extract]
results.creator_credit: Basil Dearden, Michael Relph and Allied Filmmakers
results.brief_description: Colonel Hyde, retired from the Army, launches a new company “Cooperative Removals” dedicated to helping ex-servicemen adjust themselves to civilian life. He recruited seven men into the “league of Gentlemen” who carried out his master-plan. Shows how they succeeded in relieving the Army of enough arms for their purposes. The final robbery required detailed planning, coordination of forces and split-second timing. The group retired one million pounds richer, but they made mistakes and the police finally closed around them. Cast includes Jack Hawkins, Nigel Patrick, Roger Livesey, Richard Attenborough, Bryan Forbes and Keiron More. For film studies students.
